result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Status conference on October 30, 2017 at 03:00 pm.
From Attorney Ann Terrien indicating she has closed her file on this case.

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Terrien.  Defendant plead guilty to Count 1.  Count 2 dismissed, but read in for sentencing purposes.  DPA filed with the court.    Court recited the charge and possible penalties on the count he plead to.  Defendant understood.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant.  Court reviewed the diversion agreement with the defendant.  He said he understood the agreement and can comply.  Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the pleas.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently entered his pleas and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the pleas.  Finding withheld.  DPA approved.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 17, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
STC canceled and scheduled for PLEAS at request of Atty Terrien

Pre-trial conference on August 31, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on September 19, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State. Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Terrien. Waive reading of the complaint.  Defendant stood mute.  NGP entered by the court.  PTC 8/31 and STC 9/19 at 3 pm.    Bond continued.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  Report for booking.
Adjourned initial appearance on August 8, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  Report for booking.

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and without counsel.  Court recited the charges and possible penalties contained in the complaint.  He understood.  Defendant will contact SPD.  AIA set for 8/8 at 9 a.m.
